  • About

We are Bridget and Alex, from Wales and New Zealand, and we have decided to build ourselves a house bus. Alex is a professional rugby player turned computer nerd, and I don't really know what I am yet - I'm still figuring that out. But neither of us are builders, that's for sure. Or welders. Or mechanics. Or interior designers. But we are both very practical, creative thinkers, and extremely keen to learn. We plan to spend the next couple of years up skilling (considerably), and saving as much money as we possibly can. After that will come the bus itself. We plan to import an American school bus to New Zealand, raise the roof, and build our dream home inside. The amount we don't know about school bus conversions is infinitely greater than the amount we do know at this point, so any advice is more than welcome. If you have done or are doing something similar, we'd love to hear from you. Otherwise, stick around to follow our exciting journey!

Alex Simpson

Car guy & Hobby welder

Alex is a Jack of all trades (apart from cleaning) but what he loves to do the most is fix things. Cars, computers, doors, you name it. He loves stumbling across problems, so that he can come up with a clever and creative way to combat them. His dream is to be able to work remotely from our house bus as an AWS architecht and is currently working hard to improve his public cloud knowledge so he can do just that.

Bridget Porter

Urban Hippie & Aspiring Woodworker

Bridget goes with the flow. She’s not a planner, and never has been, so planning this house bus is a big step for her. She loves to explore, learn and create. She’s happiest and most at ease when she’s surrounded by nature. An ideal day for Bridget would probably consist of some painting, a peaceful scenic walk, a twiddle on her guitar, copious amounts of Mexican food, and a bit of Alex. But only a bit.
